column1: Q1. Currently, do you allow personal devices in your classroom to be used by students for educational purposes on a daily basis?
column2: Q2. How important is the integration of technology to your everyday teaching practices?  (e.g., showing a YouTube video as an example, Google Classroom, Kahoot, etc.)
column3: Q3. Does your school have a phone policy?
column4: Q4. Under your school’s phone policy, when are students allowed to use their phones at school? Select all that apply.
column5: Q5. How does your school currently restrict access to phones? Select all that apply.
column6: Q6. Overall, how satisfied are you with your school's phone policy?
column7: Q7. How consistently do teachers and staff enforce your school's phone policy? Give your best guess.
column8: Q8. What percentage of your students are using their phone when they shouldn’t be? Give your best guess.
column9: Q9. In your opinion, should your school's phone policy be more or less restrictive than it is now?
column10: Q10. What challenges have you faced with implementing and/or enforcing the phone policy?
column11: Q11. Do you have any suggestions for overcoming those barriers?
column12: Q12. Please rate the extent to which you agree that the following statements apply to a significant number of your students.  A significant number of my students… [Seem interested in school]

column43: Q16. Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.  [I am satisfied with my co-workers’ competence.]
